control.controller
Class AdministratorController

java.lang.Object
  control.controller.GeneralUserController
      control.controller.RegisteredUserController
          control.controller.AdministratorController

public class AdministratorController
extends RegisteredUserController

AdministratorController class control all the actions that can be perform by the System Admin. This class is access by only the System Admin and this class is an extension of RegisteredUserController.

See Also:
AcademicStaff, Group, StaffTitle

Method Detail

getAllStaffUserName

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllStaffUserName()
This method gets all the AcademicStaff username.

Returns:
Set of all the AcademicStaff username.

addStaff

public boolean addStaff(java.lang.String userName,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        java.lang.String email,
                        java.lang.String fullName,
                        StaffTitle title,
                        int researchGroup)
This method add a new AcademicStaff to the system repository. Restrictions are apply when adding a new AcademicStaff to prevent duplicate entry using FullName field by checking whether the FullName is null, "ANY" or already exist in the system.

On successful operation, the repository file (profile.group2) is update.

Parameters:
userName - : System Generated identification for the new registered user.
password - : The password entered for the user.
email - : The contact email for the user.
fullName - : The Full Name of the new user.
title - : Can be marital status or academic status like Mr. Mrs, Ms or Doctor, Professor
researchGroup - : The research group for the new user.
isCoordinator - : By default, this is false, the System Admin have to assign the role.

Returns:
True, if AcademicStaff is added successfully.
False, if AcademicStaff is not added. The reason for this can be a null FullName, "ANY" or similar FullName already exist in the system.

See Also:
AcademicStaff, RegisterUser

changeStatus

public boolean changeStatus(java.lang.String userName)
This method will change the status of the user. If the user is active, it will change to inactive and vice versa. If the user is a co-ordinator, then the user is first remove from the co-ordinator status before being deactivated. Whe the user is deactivate, the groupMap is also updated. If an inactive user is change back to active, then the groupMap is update as well.

Parameters:
userName - : The username of the user whose status have to be changed.

Returns:

True, on successful opertion
False, if the username provide didnt exist

See Also:
ChangeStatus

assignCoordinator

public boolean assignCoordinator(java.lang.String userName)
This method will change the co-ordinator of a research group. If the user selected is already a co-ordinator then an error message is displayed, else, it assign the user as the new co-ordinator. In case there exist a co-ordinator, then the old coordinator is changed and the new user became the co-ordinator. After successful operation the respective file is updated.

Parameters:
userName - : This is the username of the staff to be set as a co-ordinator

Returns:
True : If the user entered is changed to a co-ordinator
False : If there is a problem

createUserName

public java.lang.String createUserName(java.lang.String uname)
This method create a username for the new user created. It takes the first character of the word in the Full name and then concatenate with the staffMap size to generate a unique id.

Parameters:
uname - : A string that contains the first character of each word of the user full name

Returns:
A string of unique username for the user
See Also:
Repository

public boolean getStaffStatus(java.lang.String userName)

Parameters:

Returns:
True : If the staff is avtive False : If the staff is inactive
See Also:

deletePublication

public boolean deletePublication(java.lang.String pubID,
                                 java.lang.String userID)
This method delete a publication from the publicationMap and from the user publication set. The method first remove the publication from the publicationMap and then remove the pubId from the publicaiton set of the user

Parameters:
pubID - : This is the publication Id of the publication to be deleted.
userID - : The username who owns this publication.

Returns:
True : If the publication is deleted successfully
False : If the publication did not exist
See Also:
Repository

checkUserName

public boolean checkUserName(java.lang.String inputUserName)
This method check whether the input username is a valid staff username before fetching his publication

Parameters:
inputUserName - : The username of the staff
Returns:
True : If the username exist
False : If it did not exist
See Also:
Repository, model.view.SystemAdminUI.DeletePublication
